LiInBr4.raw: Superionic phase above 315 K (σ rises steeply; no exact RT value given)

Li₆PS₅Cl.raw: (AIMD only, no experimental σ in this paper)

Li₆PS₅Br.raw: (AIMD only, no experimental σ in this paper)

Li₆PS₅I.raw: (AIMD only, no experimental σ in this paper)

LixA₃B₂O₁₂ (0 ≤ x ≤ 9; e.g., Li₇La₃Zr₂O₁.raw: Trend: Ce matches σexp; optimum at x = 6–7

Li₃InCl₆ sub-hydrate (Li₃InCl₆·0.5H₂O).raw: Conductivity increases drastically during dehydration; activation energy drops to ~2 eV in sub-hydrate region

LixLa₂/₃–x/3TiO₃ (0 ≤ x ≤ 0.5).raw: Trend: Ce peaks at x ≈ 0.34; σexp correlation R² = 0.812

Li3OClxBr1-x + Defects (e.g., 1Liᵢ•, 2Li.raw: Max conductivity at 2Liᵢ•• defect; σ enhanced relative to defect-free

Li₇Ag₀.₁P₃S₁₁Cl₀.₁ (270 °C).raw: (value not explicitly given, but at 270 °C highest among Cl-doped)

Li₇Ag₀.₁P₃S₁₁Br₀.₁ (270 °C).raw: (value not explicitly given, but at 270 °C improved vs pristine)

(PbF₂)₀.₅(CsF)₀.₅ (CsPbF₃).raw: No superionic transition up to 870 K

AgI (PVP-coated nanoparticles, 10–41 nm).raw: 1.5e-2 / 24 (11 nm particles); stable α-phase down to 30 °C

KAg₃Se₂ (α-phase).raw: D ≈ 1.0e-5 cm²/s at 710–740 K (QENS/AIMD); σ ~ reported in text

Ag₄Sn₃S₈.raw: Conductivity increases above ~500 K; type-II superionic transition reported

(AgI)ₓ–C(1–ₓ), x=0.99.raw: Non-Arrhenius; σ increases with T, abrupt jump at 140 °C

(AgI)ₓ–C(1–ₓ), x=0.97.raw: Non-Arrhenius; σ grows with T, reduced jump amplitude

(AgI)ₓ–C(1–ₓ), x=0.94.raw: Conductivity dominated by electrons; model only fits abrupt jump

Na₂.₉Sb₀.₉W₀.₁S₄.raw: σbulk 96 mS·cm⁻¹ / 293 K; σtotal ≈10 mS·cm⁻¹ / 293 K; σbulk 1.8 mS·cm⁻¹ / –130 °C

Binary charged colloidal crystal (RL=5 n.raw: Ionic → superionic transition at Tc ≈ 320 K; field-induced at E ≈ 1 mV/nm

Cu₂Se.raw: D ≈ 5.3×10⁻⁷ cm²/s (423 K, QENS); consistent with σ-derived D ≈ 6.1×10⁻⁷ cm²/s
